title: [Health] Heart attacks and sudden cardiac death account for 45% of deaths among firefighters while on active duty. New study finds that firefighters, police and health staff could benefit from regular check-ups and monitoring to avoid heart events at work that might harm themselves or others.

[Health] The legacy of redlining means worse cardiovascular health for present-day Black Americans. New study finds that living in historically redlined neighborhoods is associated with worse present-day cardiovascular health among Black participants, but not other racial or ethnic groups.
